title: Lady Gaga Tweeted A Sanskrit Mantra & Internet Is Going Nuts Trying To Decipher Its Meaning!
text:
Lady Gaga isn’t only a great pop icon in the west but she is also an inspiration for many women. Time and again, she has talked about being bullied and slut-shamed, yet walking out of it confidentially, she became a shining diva that she is today.

Twitter

The Poker Face singer, who recently made headlines for falling off the stage along with a fan during her concert in Las Vegas, recently broke the internet with her tweet.

Lady Gaga, as no body would have expected, tweeted a Sanskrit Mantra. "Lokah Samastah Sukhino Bhavantu," read her tweet.

Lokah Samastah Sukhino Bhavantu — Lady Gaga (@ladygaga) October 19, 2019

And since then, fans have been trying to decipher the meaning of her tweet. Some are using google translate. Some are still very clueless.

Wut pic.twitter.com/jgtduzhgjI — My Name Is James (@_JamesGtfo) October 19, 2019

Don't Miss 460 SHARES 240 SHARES 6.7 K SHARES 518 SHARES

Don't worry. Sab changa si. — Sagar (@sagarcasm) October 20, 2019

“May all beings everywhere be happy and free, and may the thoughts, words, and actions of my own life contribute in some way to that happiness and to that freedom for all.”

Love U Gaga. — Saiesha Shah (@SaieshaShah) October 20, 2019

That’s on a period pic.twitter.com/HlK99Bi3hM — LG Updates (@LadyGagaVegas) October 19, 2019

sis I know you meant stream bloody mary

pic.twitter.com/4C5AiycIJe — sean (@thehausofsean) October 19, 2019

Next line of this mantra prays for happiness of all animals.

(this mantra taken from a oldest hindu scripture "Vedas" written more than 5000 yrs back) — KundanG (@kundangautam) October 20, 2019

Jai shree ram 🙏 — Dr. Saagar Anand (@saagar_anand) October 20, 2019

It's a Sanskrit Mantra .. — 🤷🏻‍♂️ (@hi_madrista) October 19, 2019

For all those who don’t know the meaning of the Sanskrit Mantra, here it is: "May all beings everywhere be happy and free, and may the thoughts, words, and actions of my own life contribute in some way to that happiness and to that freedom for all."

Did you know Lady Gaga is quite inspired by Indian culture and women?

“I’m very inspired by Indian women. I love how Indian women take care of themselves. Their eyes, in particular, so beautiful. I have really never seen such beautiful eyebrows. I am an Italian woman and I love thick, beautiful eyebrows. After I wrote “Born This Way” and I started giving interviews, particularly interviews with Indian reporters, I’d speak about rebirth and they’d say that rebirth is a huge part of the Indian culture. So, I began to reflect on how reincarnation was relevant for my own record and how it was about being reborn over and over again in your own lifetime in a way to kill off the evil obstacles that you’ve been through and move to a place of happiness and liberation,” she had told TOI in an interview earlier.
